clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Coffee Versus Peppermint Oil Intake in Promoting GIT Motility After Cesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Coffee Versus Peppermint Oil Intake in Promoting GIT Motility After Cesarean Section

brief_summary.textblock: It is a comparison between coffee effect versus peppermint oil in promoting GIT motility after cesarean section

detailed_description.textblock:
This study includes 600 patients who underwent cesarean delivery under spinal anaethesia subdivided into two groups each contain 300 patients Group 1 will have 100 ml of coffee after 2,4 and 6 hours Group 2 will have 100 me of pepper mint oil After 2,4 and 6 hours
Then outcomes will be assessed as per time frame

primary_outcome.measure: Regain of GIT motility after cesarean section by auscultation of intestinal sound
primary_outcome.description: Auscultation of intestinal sounds hourly for first 12. Hours

secondary_outcome.description: Recording time for first time of vomiting

secondary_outcome.measure: Need of medication to enhance motility of GIT
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing need for extra medications for motility

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of hospital stay after surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- willingness to participate.
- uncomplicated pregnancy.
- uncomplicated cesarean section.
- under regional anesthesia
- BMI<30kg/m.
- level of hemoglobin is 10g/dl or more
Exclusion Criteria:
- medical disorders in the form of HTN,DM and hepatic disorders and bleeding disorders
- intra operative bowel or bladder injury during the cesarean section
- intra operative severe bleeding
- chronic gastrointestinal problems like chronic constipation ,peptic ulcer ,esophagitis ,hiatus hernia and IBS
- sever intestinal adhesions
- Respiratory problems and infection that require medication intervention
- operation more than 90 minutes
